did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, minutes of meetings, clippings, and other printed matter, relating to communism and socialism in the United States and Europe.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

chronitem.event: Elected to New York State Legislature
Expelled from Socialist Party. Founding member, Communist Labor Party (later merged into Communist Party). Convicted under New York criminal syndicalism law and imprisoned
Communist candidate for mayor of New York City
Communist candidate for Vice President of the U.S.
Member, board of directors, American Fund for Public Service (Garland Fund)
Elected alternate member, Executive Committee, Communist International
Elected secretary-general, Communist Party. Expelled from Communist Party. Founding member, Communist Party (Majority Group) (later known as Communist Party [Opposition])
Founding member and principal leader of three successive small organizations: Workers Communist League, Labor Party Association, and Organization Committee for a Revolutionary Workers Party
Anti-communist witness before U.S. House Un-American Activities Committee
Author, I Confess: The Truth about American Communism
Author, The Whole of Their Lives: Communism in America: A Personal History and Intimate Portrayal of Its Leaders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, galleys, and printed copies of speeches and writings by Benjamin Gitlow, together with letters, clippings, and other related material, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, minutes, reports, resolutions, statements, memoranda, notes, bulletins, leaflets, clippings, and other printed matter, arranged alphabetically by topic.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Two photographs of striking silk workers, Paterson, New Jersey, 1931; and 1 miscellaneous drawing.
